title: If my entire house suddenly was made out of one random element, what are some possible things that could happen? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let’s take a look at the periodic table… There are 11 gaseous elements. For some of these you’ll just take a little fall, because your house just drifted away in the wind. Some are heavy and might suffocate you if you don’t quickly leave the vicinity. The problems are Fluorine and Chlorine. You’ve just gassed your neighborhood. Oh, and radon might give you cancer. The 2 liquids are bromine and mercury. Bromine is toxic and corrosive, and you fell into a swimming pool of it. Good luck. Mercury is actually pretty safe if you’re just touching it…sadly you have a ton of mercury directly over your head. It’s as heavy as bricks. Ouch. There are 5 solid non-metals and 8 metalloids. Most of them are soft, so…not that great but better than the liquids. Some of the ~50 metals are fairly safe. However, there are poisonous ones, so you better hold your breath. But that won’t really help you if your house immediately collapses, because a lot of the metals are either too weak to build a house out of, or too heavy to build a roof out of. If you survive a gold, silver or platinum house…you might be rich! Most of the 6 alkali metals react violently with water, and you’re mostly water. Lithium and sodium would be dangerous. If you got potassium, you’re on fire. If you got rubidium, you’re probably in little flaming chunks. If you got caesium, your entire neighborhood is probably in little flaming chunks. Let’s not talk about francium. The effects of the 26 transuranic elements range from giving passersby cancer, to explosions, to removing everything within a few km radius from existence. I may be underestimating them. After all this…If you survive you’ll be national news and the government may want to have words with you about how you got yourself into this situation. Very strong words.

Well, I am by no means an expert in the chemical or physical properties of all of the elements, and I haven't the time to write a detail of all of them, so here’s the TLDR of them. Any of the gasses, I hope there isn't a basement under you, regardless of toxicity of the gas.Mercury would result in catastrophic contamination of the area’s water supply.The transuranic elements will kill the entire neighborhood.
